realclearpolitics.com  (WEB - en-US)

A popular political news aggregation and commentary site that features polling data, election tracking, and political commentary. The site also runs news and opinion pieces from other publications that reflect a cross-section of political views.

This website generally maintains basic standards of credibility and transparency.
Does not repeatedly publish false content
Gathers and presents information responsibly
Regularly corrects or clarifies errors
Handles the difference between news and opinion responsibly
Avoids deceptive headlines
Website discloses ownership and financing
Clearly labels advertising
Reveals who's in charge, including any possible conflicts of interest
The site provides names of content creators, along with either contact or biographical information

Ownership and Financing

RealClearPolitics (RCP) is operated by RealClear Media Group, a private media company formed in February 2016 by the founders of the site. The company is owned by founders John McIntyre and Tom Bevan; chief technology officer Anand Ramanujan; and Crest Media, a marketing agency that owns Al-Monitor, a prominent Middle Eastern news outlet.

The site derives revenue from advertising.

Content

RealClearPolitics features original and aggregated content and is aimed at providing what the site calls “balanced, non-partisan analysis.” The site’s mission, it states, is “to give readers an objective look at the news landscape every single day.” Original commentary stories range from “The Case for Nancy Pelosi” (August 2018) to “How the Senate Lost Its Decorum” (September 2018.)

Content on Realclearpolitics.com includes both written and video content. Its front page includes articles from a range of political viewpoints, and also links to coverage from other sites. Subject categories include the congressional midterm elections, the Trump administration, international conflicts, video highlights, and media and politics.

The site also publishes original podcasts, daily newsletters, and its RCP Poll Average, an aggregation of data from multiple polls that is frequently cited by prominent news organizations.

Contributors to RealClear Politics come from a variety of political background and include veteran journalists and commentators such as Lou Cannon, Sally Persons, and Bill Scher.

Credibility

Aggregated stories on the site are drawn from both sides of the political spectrum. Articles featured on the site’s homepage one day in early September 2018 included a piece from Vanity Fair headlined “Is Trump Too Doltish to Be Dangerous?” and a Fox News article, “Nike, Tell Me Again What Kaepernick Sacrificed?”

RCP’s original articles cite multiple credible sources. In April 2018, the site announced its own fact-checking initiative, Fact Check Review, described as a project “to explore how the flagship fact-checking organizations operate in practice.”

Realclearpolitics does not list a corrections policy, but regularly appends corrections to the bottom of stories.

Transparency

The site’s About page includes the names and email addresses of its executive and editorial staff and discloses RCP’s ownership by RealClear Media Group. The bylines of original articles written by non-staff contributors often include biographical information. Many bylines of staff members link to profiles that include their social media handles and email addresses.

The site clearly labels all advertising.

History

McIntyre and Bevan founded the site in August 2000 as a way, they said, to present political  news in one accessible location.
